Detailed Description

MmCallHandler is the central class for handling call events. It provides methods for setting up a call, accepting or rejecting an incoming call and releasing an active call. Furthermore it provides access to the CallHandlingData object held by the MainHandler.

The MmCallHandler has to be subscribed (StackControl::Subscribe(MmCallHandlerId);) on startup of the application. All further initialization of the components needed by the MmCallHandler are intitialzed within the Handler or its subcomponents.

Member Function Documentation

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::Accept (  const CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Accepts an incoming (mobile terminated) multi-media call. Returns NoError if it has been successfully accepted. A MmCallSetupProgressMsg is sent during execution of Accept(). Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Parameters:
call_index Apoxi Id of the call to accept
Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, ActiveCallDetected, InvalidCallIndex, VoidCallIndex or CallDisconnected.

void MmCallHandler::DisconnectActivePsdCalls (   ) 
 

Disconnects all active psd calls

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::GetCurrentCallMeter (  const CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Initiates the sending of the message MmCurrentChargeDataMsg for one time if the call identified by call_index exists.

Returns:
VoidCallIndex if the CallHdl is not valid any more, SupplementaryService failed if AoC is not supported for this call, NoError otherwise.

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::GetCurrentChargeData (  const CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Initiates the sending of the message MmCurrentCallMeterMsg for one time, if the call identified by call_index exists.

Returns:
VoidCallIndex if the MmCallHdl is not valid any more, SupplementaryService failed if AoC is not supported for this call, NoError otherwise.

returns the Handler ID of the MmCallHandler

Socket * MmCallHandler::GetSocket (  CallIndex  call_index  ) 
 

Returns the socket for the data connection. Write and Read methods at the returned socket cause an error if the call is not in active state

Parameters:
index Index of the call the socket belongs to

Returns TRUE if the SerialTerminal provided in the parameter terminal is in online mode or not.

Parameters:

Returns:
TRUE if terminal is in online mode, FALSE otherwise

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::Reject (  const CallIndex  call_index,
ClearCause  cause = SubscriberBusy,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
) 
 

Releases a mobile terminated call before it is accepted and sends the calling party information about the cause for the release..

Parameters:
call_index Apoxi Id of the call to reject
cause The default cause SubscriberBusy, is used when the called user has indicated the inability to accept another call.
Returns:
See CallHdl::Release.

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::RejectAllMtc (  BOOLEAN  activate  ) 
 

Enables/disables blocking of all mobile terminated calls.

Parameters:
activate TRUE activates, FALSE deactivates blocking.
Returns:
NoError - If blocking successfully enabled or disabled. CallDataLocked if another thread currently blocks the internal data structures.

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::Release (  const CallIndex  call_index,
TimeSpan *  calling_time = 0,
BOOLEAN  wait_condition = FALSE
)  [virtual]
 

Releases a mobile terminated or mobile originated voice call. May be invoked during call setup and call active phase. The internal data will be immediately updated. There is no active wait for the networks release confirmation, since the confirmation will be generated by the protocol stack if the network fails to answer within 30 sec. Refer to the documentation of CallApiRc for a detailed description of the return values.

Parameters:
call_index Apoxi Id of the call to release
calling_time - Is set to the call duration (time span).
wait_condition TRUE for synchronous waiting of release
Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error, one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, InvalidCallIndex, VoidCallIndex.

void MmCallHandler::ReportCurrentCallMeter (  BOOLEAN  activate  ) 
 

Starts the automatic reporting of the current call meter (CCM) in home units. The message MmCurrentCallMeterMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated (but not more than once within 2 seconds) until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of CCM if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

void MmCallHandler::ReportCurrentCharge (  BOOLEAN  activate  ) 
 

Starts the automatic reporting of the current charge in currency units. The message MmCurrentChargeDataMsg will be sent each time when the CCM is calculated until the automatic reporting is stopped by calling this method with parameter activate set to FALSE.

Parameters:
activate Starts reporting of current charge if TRUE, stops reporting if FALSE.

CallApiRc MmCallHandler::Setup (  const CallIndex  call_index,
const PhoneNumber &  phone_no,
ClirMode  clir_mode = DontCare
) 
 

Establishes a mobile originated multi-media call. During the execution of Setup(const PhoneNumber & phone_no), several info-messages on setup progress are sent.

Parameters:
call_index Apoxi Id of the call to setup
phone_no The phone number of the call to be set up.
clir_mode SuppressPhoneNumber or DisplayPhoneNumber. By default DontCare will be used.
Returns:
NoError - If executed successfully. In case of error one of the following values will be returned: CallDataLocked, NoNetwork, ActiveCallDetected, SetupCallDetected, MaxCallCountExceeded, CallDisconnected, CallSetupRejected.
